channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. Officials Try to Advance Israel’s Cease-Fire Talks With Hezbollah and Hamas
item.description: William Burns, the C.I.A. director, is making a last-ditch attempt to move Gaza talks along before U.S. elections next week.

item.title: Spain Flash Floods: Scenes From the Deluge
item.description: Flash flooding across Spain killed more than 95 people after torrential rain left towns and villages submerged and turned streets into rivers.

item.title: House Covid Panel Refers Andrew Cuomo for Potential Prosecution
item.description: The Republican-led House subcommittee asked the Justice Department to investigate Mr. Cuomo for possible prosecution for “false statements” in his tes...

item.title: Google Maps just got a fresh injection of AI features—here’s what you can do now
item.description: “We are entering a new era of maps,” Google Maps general manager Miriam Daniel said.

item.title: Two years ago, world leaders established a global Pandemic Fund. Now its co-chairs are warning it needs at least $2 billion by June
item.description: Due to the high demand in many countries, the Pandemic Fund will exhaust most of its funds by next June.

item.title: In Georgia, Harris Supporters Pull Together and Fight the Odds
item.description: It’s not easy being a dot of blue in Trump country.

item.title: A Fiery Bernie Sanders Courts Blue-Collar Voters
item.description: The Vermont senator’s appearances on the trail to support Vice President Kamala Harris stand in stark contrast to her optimistic message.

item.title: You can own Christian Bale’s Batmobile, but you’ll need a Bruce Wayne-sized fortune to afford it
item.description: A total of 10 vehicles will be sold.

item.title: 8 Supreme Court Justices in Mexico to Resign Ahead of Contentious Election
item.description: All but three of the country’s Supreme Court justices announced they would quit rather than partake in the controversial elections mandated by a judic...

item.title: Flash Floods in Spain Kill at Least 158: What to Know
item.description: At least 158 people were killed after the downpour, which some residents said was the worst they had ever witnessed.

item.title: Spain Flash Floods: Scenes From the Deluge
item.description: Flash flooding across Spain killed more than 95 people after torrential rain left towns and villages submerged and turned streets into rivers.

item.title: U.S. Officials Try to Advance Israel’s Cease-Fire Talks With Hezbollah and Hamas
item.description: William Burns, the C.I.A. director, is making a last-ditch attempt to move Gaza talks along before U.S. elections next week.

item.title: COVID-19 is no longer the world’s leading infectious disease killer
item.description: A longtime leading killer retakes the lead.

item.title: After Flash Floods in Spain, Rescuers and Residents Face a Grim Scene
item.description: At least 158 people have died, and others are still missing, though how many remains unclear. Rescuers feared finding more bodies, the defense ministe...

item.title: Trump won’t vote early even though he said twice last week ‘I’ll be voting early’
item.description: “I’ll be voting early. I’ll be voting early,” Trump told Fox News host Brian Kilmeade.
